data.name: Big Integer Modulo II
data.description:
This kata is meant to be a continuation (generalization) of the [Big Integer Modulo](http://www.codewars.com/kata/big-integer-modulo) kata. However it's not necessary to solve that one in order to pass this one, but it might help you as this generalizes the idea.

Your job in this kata is to **calculate the modulo of an arbitrarily big integer** passed as a **string** (`numberString`) in certain `base` after dividing it by a given **integer** `divisor`. In order to do that, you need to implement the `bigModulo(numberString, divisor, base)` function, taking into account that:

* The base parameter is optional (**must** be `10` by default) and its value will be between **2 and 36** (all inputs will be within this range,  so you don't need to check for this).
* All the possible 36 digits will go from `0..9` followed by `A..Z`; conversion to uppercase may be necessary.
* Input strings will **always** be valid regarding to the base. i.e.: test won't include something like `bigModulo('FF', 13, 2)` (as 'F' is not a digit in base 2).

**[Optional] Hints Available at the end of the *Big Integer Modulo* kata mentioned in the first paragraph.**
